result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katherine K Davis

records.addlTxt: Defense counsel requested adjournment due to defendant currently in treatment. Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36; both parties agreed to date and time. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Katherine K Davis in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Katherine K Davis.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned to branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Katherine K Davis in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Defense acknowledges receipt of blood results and requests a status date to allow additional time to review results with client.  Upon request from the Defense, Court vacates jury trial scheduled on September 12, 2022.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: State's Requested Jury Instructions

Defendant Katherine K Davis in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense awaiting blood results and request an additional scheduling. Court sets this matter for final pretrial and jury trial. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Katherine K Davis in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Brown Deer Police Officer D. Reed. Court took Judical Notice as to the defendants 3 prior OWI convictions.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Katherine K Davis in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Katherine K Davis in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Katherine K Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
